trans-unit.source: Sections FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Sections FastTab

trans-unit.source: The Sections FastTab defines the different sections of the report. Each section has a table that the system should loop through in order to generate the data.

seg-source.mrk: The Sections FastTab defines the different sections of the report.
Each section has a table that the system should loop through in order to generate the data.

trans-unit.source: : Document Layout, Sections FastTab

seg-source.mrk: : Document Layout, Sections FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Section Type

seg-source.mrk: Section Type

trans-unit.source: Controls how the section should be printed. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Controls how the section should be printed.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Header – The section will be printed on top of the page and will be transferred to the other pages.

seg-source.mrk: Header – The section will be printed on top of the page and will be transferred to the other pages.

trans-unit.source: Line – The section will be printed between the header and footer and will be different from page to page.

seg-source.mrk: Line – The section will be printed between the header and footer and will be different from page to page.

trans-unit.source: Footer – The section will be printed at the bottom of the page and will be transferred to other pages.

seg-source.mrk: Footer – The section will be printed at the bottom of the page and will be transferred to other pages.

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Short description of the section. This field is optional but makes it easier to identify the purpose of each line.

seg-source.mrk: Short description of the section.
This field is optional but makes it easier to identify the purpose of each line.

trans-unit.source: Table No.

seg-source.mrk: Table No.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the table that the system should loop through for the section.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the table that the system should loop through for the section.

trans-unit.source: Table Name

seg-source.mrk: Table Name

trans-unit.source: Displays the name of the table.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the name of the table.

trans-unit.source: Key No.

seg-source.mrk: Key No.

trans-unit.source: Sets the order in which the system should loop through the table.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the order in which the system should loop through the table.

trans-unit.source: Key

seg-source.mrk: Key

trans-unit.source: Displays the name of the key.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the name of the key.

trans-unit.source: Descending

seg-source.mrk: Descending

trans-unit.source: Changes the order of the key to descending (high to low).

seg-source.mrk: Changes the order of the key to descending (high to low).

trans-unit.source: Pages

seg-source.mrk: Pages

trans-unit.source: Controls on what pages the section should be printed. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Controls on what pages the section should be printed.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: All – Section is printed on all pages.

seg-source.mrk: All – Section is printed on all pages.

trans-unit.source: First – Section is only printed on the first page.

seg-source.mrk: First – Section is only printed on the first page.

trans-unit.source: Last – Section is only printed on the last page. (Only possible in Classic Render Report)

seg-source.mrk: Last – Section is only printed on the last page.
(Only possible in Classic Render Report)

trans-unit.source: Not First – Section is printed on all pages except the first one. (Only possible in Classic Render Report)

seg-source.mrk: Not First – Section is printed on all pages except the first one.
(Only possible in Classic Render Report)

trans-unit.source: Not Last – Section is printed on all pages except the last one. (Only possible in Classic Render Report)

seg-source.mrk: Not Last – Section is printed on all pages except the last one.
(Only possible in Classic Render Report)

trans-unit.source: This field – along with Section Type = Header – provides the ability to create a smaller header for the second and following pages in the reports. However, not all options from the Classic Render Report are possible now. Section Type = Header allows for rendering on Pages = All or First, whereas line and footer sections do not allow any page controlling at all. Page Control has been added to the new Document Layouts with code “03”; refer to these for more information about using page control in layouts.

seg-source.mrk: This field – along with Section Type = Header – provides the ability to create a smaller header for the second and following pages in the reports.
However, not all options from the Classic Render Report are possible now.
Section Type = Header allows for rendering on Pages = All or First, whereas line and footer sections do not allow any page controlling at all.
Page Control has been added to the new Document Layouts with code “03”; refer to these for more information about using page control in layouts.

trans-unit.source: Page Break

seg-source.mrk: Page Break

trans-unit.source: Determines the page breaks.

seg-source.mrk: Determines the page breaks.

trans-unit.source: For the flow layout render report and a line of Section Type = Line, the following options are available to determine whether to force a page break or not:

seg-source.mrk: For the flow layout render report and a line of Section Type = Line, the following options are available to determine whether to force a page break or not:

trans-unit.source: Between Records – Will create a page break between each record inside the filtered section.

seg-source.mrk: Between Records – Will create a page break between each record inside the filtered section.

trans-unit.source: After Block – Will create a page break after the last record (if at least one was found).

seg-source.mrk: After Block – Will create a page break after the last record (if at least one was found).

trans-unit.source: After Each Record – Will create a page break according to options Between Records and After Block.

seg-source.mrk: After Each Record – Will create a page break according to options Between Records and After Block.

trans-unit.source: Page breaks for phantom layouts must be configured inside the phantom layout.

seg-source.mrk: Page breaks for phantom layouts must be configured inside the phantom layout.

trans-unit.source: Phantom Layout No.

seg-source.mrk: Phantom Layout No.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the Phantom Layout No. for the section.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the Phantom Layout No.
for the section.

trans-unit.source: Phantom layouts are special layouts that are defined without a report number and are used for generating sections in multiple layouts. The purpose of a phantom layout is to create and maintain a sort of template text that can be reused on multiple layouts. For example, if the footer needs to be the same in all documents, a phantom layout can be created and assigned to all document layout sections.

seg-source.mrk: Phantom layouts are special layouts that are defined without a report number and are used for generating sections in multiple layouts.
The purpose of a phantom layout is to create and maintain a sort of template text that can be reused on multiple layouts.
For example, if the footer needs to be the same in all documents, a phantom layout can be created and assigned to all document layout sections.

trans-unit.source: If the text ever changes, it can be done for all documents at once by changing only the phantom layout text.

seg-source.mrk: If the text ever changes, it can be done for all documents at once by changing only the phantom layout text.

seg-source.mrk: No.
of Codeunits

trans-unit.source: Displays the number of codeunits set up for the section.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the number of codeunits set up for the section.

seg-source.mrk: No.
of Criteria

trans-unit.source: Displays the number of criteria set up for the section.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the number of criteria set up for the section.

trans-unit.source: No. of Fields

seg-source.mrk: No.
of Fields

trans-unit.source: Displays the number of fields set up for the section.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the number of fields set up for the section.

trans-unit.source: No. of Filters

seg-source.mrk: No.
of Filters

trans-unit.source: Displays the number of filters set up for the section.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the number of filters set up for the section.

seg-source.mrk: No.
of Variables

trans-unit.source: Displays the number of variables set up for the section.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the number of variables set up for the section.

trans-unit.source: : Sections FastTab, actions on the Line menu

seg-source.mrk: : Sections FastTab, actions on the Line menu

trans-unit.source: Action

seg-source.mrk: Action

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Move Right

seg-source.mrk: Move Right

trans-unit.source: Increases the indentation of the section. A section indented below another section will iterate once for each of the parent sections.

seg-source.mrk: Increases the indentation of the section.
A section indented below another section will iterate once for each of the parent sections.

trans-unit.source: Move Left

seg-source.mrk: Move Left

trans-unit.source: Decreases the indentation of the section.

seg-source.mrk: Decreases the indentation of the section.

trans-unit.source: Copy Section

seg-source.mrk: Copy Section

trans-unit.source: Copies a section setup from another Document Layout.

seg-source.mrk: Copies a section setup from another Document Layout.

trans-unit.source: When copying a section, the Filters, Criteria, Codeunits, Variables and Fields are all updated. If copying from a section that is based on another table, the system will replace that table with the table of the section copied to. This allows, e.g., copying the header of an order confirmation to the header of a sales invoice (then table 36 will be replaced by table 112).

seg-source.mrk: When copying a section, the Filters, Criteria, Codeunits, Variables and Fields are all updated.
If copying from a section that is based on another table, the system will replace that table with the table of the section copied to.
This allows, e.g., copying the header of an order confirmation to the header of a sales invoice (then table 36 will be replaced by table 112).
